edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm

Class PlainTCPSocketChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.comm.PlainChannel
      • edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm.PlainTCPSocketChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Channel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SSLSocketChannel

    public class PlainTCPSocketChannel
extends PlainChannel
    This class represents a concrete channel in the Decorator Pattern used to create Channels. This channel ensures TCP type of communication. In order to enforce the right usage of the Channel class we will restrict the ability to instantiate one, only to classes within the Two Party Communication Layer's package. This means that the constructor of the channel will be unreachable from another package. However, the send, receive and close functions will be declared public, therefore allowing anyone holding a channel to be able to use them. The difference between this implementation to the PlainTCPChannel is that here there are two sockets: one used to receive messages and one used to send messages. The other PlainTCPChannel has one socket used both to send and receive.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

        public boolean isClosed()
        Checks if the channel os closed or not.
        Returns:
        true if the channel is closed; False, otherwise.

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Connects the socket to the InetSocketAddress of this object. If the server we are trying to connect to is not up yet then we sleep for a while and try again until the connection is established. This is done by the SocketCommunicationSetup which keeps trying until it succeeds or a timeout has been reached.

        After the connection has succeeded the output stream is set for the send function.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setReceiveSocket

        public void setReceiveSocket(java.net.Socket socket)
        Sets the receive socket and the input stream.
        Parameters:
        socket - the receive socket to set.
